Package SampleCAT

Class Device.TicketOutput

java.lang.Object
SampleCAT.Device.TicketOutput
Enclosing class:
Device
static class Device.TicketOutput extends Object
Class to process ticket data provided by the terminal to be printed on an attached printer.

  • Field Details

    • HEADSIZE

      static final int HEADSIZE
      Additional size per ticket for journal media, if ElectronicJournal is used for ticket output. This is the difference between the size per ticket and the product of (maximum lines per ticket) * (characters per line).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TransactionDate

      String TransactionDate
      Date of CAT transaction corresponding to the ticket in format YYYYmmddHHMMSS. Must be set before releasing the object.

  • Constructor Details

    • TicketOutput

      TicketOutput()
      The constructor. No further operation.

  • Method Details

    • prepare

      void prepare() throws jpos.JposException
      Prepares object for later use. Called immediately after the first call of checkProperties.
      Throws:
      jpos.JposException - If object would not work correctly with the configuration in jpos.xml.

    • init

      void init() throws jpos.JposException
      Initializes the object for ticket output operation.
      Throws:
      jpos.JposException - If ticket output would not work.

    • release

      void release()
      Locks object for further ticket output operation.

    • cleanup

      void cleanup()
      Frees all resources hold by the object.

    • setTicket

      void setTicket(int count, String contents)
      Processes ticket data. Currently, three methods of processing ticket data are available:
      • Ticket data will be passed to the application via firing a DirectIOEvent object.
      • Ticket data will be written to customer or merchant journal.
      • Ticket data will be printed by the pos printer.
      After the current CAT operation has been finished, the application should merge the tickets with the sales receipt transaction and (optionally) print tickets that fulfill the needs of customer and merchant.
      This method must not be called more than once per transaction. If called more than once, the contents of previous calls might be overwritten. This is no restriction because the sample implementation sends no more than one ticket per CAT transaction.
      Parameters:
      count - Number of tickets (1 or 2). If 1, only one ticket must be printed. If two, merchant and customer ticket must be printed.
      contents - Contents of ticket. May contain printable characters and new line characters.
